Uses of FutureCallback in com.barchart.util.concurrent
 

Classes in com.barchart.util.concurrent with type parameters of type FutureCallback
 class CancellableFutureNotifier<V,T extends FutureCallback<V,T>>
           
 interface FutureCallback<V,T extends FutureCallback<V,T>>
           Adds listener notification methods to Future to allow immediate notification when a result is available.
 class FutureNotifierBase<V,T extends FutureCallback<V,T>>
          An implementation of FutureCallback that does not do any actual computation, but just serves as a communication proxy between the executor and listeners.
 

Classes in com.barchart.util.concurrent that implement FutureCallback
 class CancellableFutureNotifier<V,T extends FutureCallback<V,T>>
           
 class FutureCallbackList<E>
          Groups a number of FutureCallbackTask results together, and executes a single callback only after all FutureCallbacks have completed (succeeded or failed.) This class does not support direct access to succeed() or fail(), and will throw and UnsupportedOperationException for them.
 class FutureCallbackTask<E>
           Basic implementation of FutureCallback based on FutureTask.
 class FutureNotifier<V>
          An implementation of FutureCallback that does not do any actual computation, but just serves as a communication proxy between the executor and listeners.
 class FutureNotifierBase<V,T extends FutureCallback<V,T>>
          An implementation of FutureCallback that does not do any actual computation, but just serves as a communication proxy between the executor and listeners.
